title: Has Covid-19 killed more people than AIDS? - Quora

response.answer_text: Not even close, at less than 24,073 deaths as of now (3–26 10PM[1]), that is far from the over 32 million people that have died world wide because of HIV[2], and more 700,000 in the USA[3] . The rate of Covid-19 transmission is alarming, however, the means of transmission is much harder to combat than HIV. Rather than being infected even thru breath, HIV transmission is thru bodily fluids, and according to the CDC, sodomy accounted for 82% of diagnoses among males[4] and 70% of all new HIV diagnoses[5] , and 2 out of every 3[6] diagnoses in the United States. Which is despite only representing approximately 4% of the male population)[7]. Which means it should be easier to prevent. Footnotes[1] Coronavirus Update (Live): 531,797 Cases and 24,071 Deaths from COVID-19 Virus Outbreak[2] HIV/AIDS[3] The HIV/AIDS Epidemic in the United States: The Basics[4] Men | Gender | HIV by Group | HIV/AIDS | CDC[5] HIV and Gay and Bisexual Men[6] 63 Stunning HIV Statistics[7] https://www.cdc.gov/nchhstp/newsroom/docs/2012/hiv-infections-2007-2010.pdf

Not even remotely close. Since the beginning of the aids epidemic in 1981, 32 million people have died and around 750,000 more die every year. To date, Covid 19 has killed roughly 26,000 people. Source WHO
